text: I am totally new to programming as though I have my PhD as a molecular biologist for the last 10 years.
Can someone please tell me: Would it be too hard to handle if I enrolled simultaneously in C++ and python?
I am a full time employee too.
Both courses start and finish on the same dates and is for 3 months.
For a variety of complicated reasons, this fall is the only time I can learn both languages.

Update:
A little more detail about myself: as I said I did a PhD in Molecular Genetic.
I now wish to be able to obtain programming skills so that I can apply it to do bioinformatics- like sequence manipulation and pathway analysis.
I was told that Python is great for that but our course does not cover basics for beginners.
I approached a Comp Sci Prof. who suggested that I learn C++ first before learning Python.
So I got into this dilemma (added to other logistics).
